subject: STANDARD BANK PLC
body:
STANDARD BANK PLC
200,Gresham Street, London, EC2V 7JE, England,
United Kingdom Standard Advisory London Limited
Tel: +44 20 3107 500
E-mail: 
standardbankuk@yahoo.com
/standardbankuks@gmail.com
FUND TRANSFER NOTIFICATION ORDER FROM GOVERNMENT OF NIGERIA TO STANDARD BANK OF UK.
Attention: Fund Ownership,
Dear: Beneficiary,
This is to bring your urgent notice going on the instruction received from the Nigeria honorable Minister of Finance who directed your fund payment advice to our affiliate International Paying Bank hare in the UK as their Nigeria Government has an offshore account with our standard bank.
We hereby to serve you better and Credit your bank account through our wire transfer instrument as you cooperate with us based on the above instruction received from Nigeria finance minister Mr. Wale Edun, on your transfer payment order, also you are advised to contact the attorney in charge for fund release papers such as approval/clearance certificate for your urgent payment while finance minister will finally endorse it and forward all the copies to our office.
However the standard bank will help you check met and monitor the entire original paper works required  after you have retrieved the hard copies from  attorney office, while the minister will  assist signing it out on the original transfer documents, kindly  contact  attorney office  via his email address contact Below:-
Festus Kimu Chambers. For (FGN).
Barr. Festus Kimu, (SAN)
E-mail: 
festuskimu.chambers@gmail.com
Note that you have to contact his office immediately and try letting standard bank know to follow him up on the fund documents till it gets to standard Bank UK.
Best Regards
Lungisa Fuzile
Standard Bank UK
Foreign Operation Director.

subject: Re:   STANDARD BANK PLC
body:
Hello,

Thank you for reaching out to me. I'm quite intrigued by this information. Could you please provide more details about the fund transfer order from the Government of Nigeria? 

Also, could you explain how the process works with Standard Bank UK and what my role would be in it? I'm not very familiar with these financial procedures, so any additional information would be greatly appreciated.

Looking forward to hearing from you soon.

Best regards.

Best wishes,
Courtney
